*Mus musculus bactrianus *Mus musculus castaneus *Mus musculus domesticus *Mus

| range_map = Mapa Mus musculus.png range_map_caption = House mouse range
}} The 'house mouse' (Mus musculus) is a small rodent, a mouse. It is one of the
most numerous species of the genus [[Mus (genus)|Mus]]. Although a wild animal,
the house mouse mainly lives associated with humans, causing damage to crops and
stored food.

The house mouse has been domesticated as the pet or fancy mouse, and as the
laboratory mouse, which is one of the most important model organisms in biology
and medicine. It is by far the animal most commonly genetically altered for
scientific research.
